summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to a colleague, forwarding an order from Judge Nathan regarding a teleconference on jury selection for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The email requests an update to a victim website with the teleconference access information.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued an order regarding a teleconference to discuss jury selection matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, forwarding Judge Nathan's order and requesting an update to the victim website with teleconference access details.

connections.description: Professional correspondence between colleagues at the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding case logistics.
Judge Nathan issued an order that the prosecutor is acting upon and disseminating.

events.title: Jury Selection Teleconference
events.description: The Court holds a telephone conference to discuss jury selection matters for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, with a live audio feed accessible to the press and public.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Judge Nathan issued an order regarding a teleconference on jury selection for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial scheduled for October 21, 2021.
The U.S. Attorney's Office maintained a 'victim website' to disseminate information about the case proceedings.
The teleconference was to be accessible via a live audio feed to members of the press and public, both within and outside the United States.
